poem:
"Shifting Sands of Economic Shores"

A falling needle's shadow shifts the market,
in fretful zigzags, like a desert snake.
City men reel, their suits the hue of oil,
yet their bellies, hollow, taste the dust of interest.

Unemployment whispers through the city,
in this, the year of the bitter wage,
and the brass-edged worry, slowly seeping,
draws portraits on the faces of the lost.
